e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and truthfulness, maintaining stakeholder trust by reflecting a full and realistic picture of financial health without manipulative practices. It should comply with legal standards, be free of biases that obscure true performance, and offer clear communication that empowers all investors, improving company integrity and stakeholder relations.
e6: What strategies have been considered to effectively communicate the change in reporting policy to all investors, ensuring they understand the new approach? Also, how does the management plan to mitigate any short-term negative reactions in the market during the transition?
